summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Darren Indyke, executor of Jeffrey Epstein's estate, demanding production of documents related to 'The 1953 Trust' referenced in Epstein's will. The document includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing criminal investigation.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.context: Recipient of the grand jury subpoena, required to produce documents related to Jeffrey Epstein's trust and appear before the grand jury.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the deceased individual whose estate and trust documents are being subpoenaed as part of a federal criminal investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Signed the subpoena cover letter as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: Indyke is the executor of Epstein's estate, responsible for handling his will and trust documents.
Berman, as U.S. Attorney, issued the grand jury subpoena to Indyke demanding documents and testimony.

events.title: Execution of Jeffrey Epstein's Will
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein executed his Last Will and Testament, which references 'The 1953 Trust'.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issued a grand jury subpoena to Darren Indyke for documents related to Epstein's trust.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: Darren Indyke was commanded to appear before the grand jury to testify regarding alleged federal criminal violations.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
U.S. Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an ongoing federal grand jury investigation into suspected felonies including violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c), 2422(b) (coercion/enticement), and 371 (conspiracy).
The government specifically requested documents related to 'The 1953 Trust' referenced in Jeffrey Epstein's will executed on August 8, 2019.
The subpoena includes a non-disclosure request, asking Indyke not to reveal the existence of the subpoena to preserve investigation confidentiality.
Darren Indyke faced potential contempt of court charges and penalties if he failed to comply with the subpoena's demands.
The document reveals the government's focus on Epstein's financial arrangements and trust structures as part of their criminal investigation.
